message: This is the first product I'm offering you. I'm confident that it's a great opportunity, and I'm willing to give you a special deal. If you buy this product, I'll throw in a free consultation to help you understand its full potential. Plus, I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied, we can discuss a potential refund. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. Let me give you a bit more context. This product is a one-of-a-kind opportunity that I've been holding onto for a while. It's not just a product, it's an investment in your future. I'm willing to make a bold statement: I'm so confident in this product that I'm willing to offer you a 'take it or leave it' deal. If you buy this product now, I'll give you an exclusive deal of $8000. But if you don't buy it, I'll have to pass it on to someone else. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision. I'm not willing to pay $8000 for a product that might be low-quality.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I want to assure you that this product is indeed a high-quality one. I've done my research, and I'm confident that it will meet your expectations. In fact, I'm so confident that I'm willing to give you a special deal. If you buy this product now, I'll give you an exclusive deal of $10000. This is the lowest price I've ever offered for a high-quality product like this, and I think it's a steal. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the risk and buy the product at the discounted price of $10000. I'm hoping it's a high-quality product that will be worth $20000 to me.

I'm glad you took the chance on the previous product, Bob! I'm happy to report that it was indeed a high-quality product, and I'm sure you're enjoying the benefits. Now, let's talk about this new product. I know you're eager to make another smart investment, and I'm here to help. This product is also a high-quality one, and I'm willing to offer you an even better deal than before. I'll give you a special deal of $9500 for this product. It's a one-time offer, and I think it's a steal. What do you say?
I'm willing to take another chance and buy the product at the discounted price of $9500. I'm hoping it's another high-quality product that will be worth $20000 to me.

Bob, I'm glad you're feeling confident about your investment strategy! However, I want to caution you that this next product is a bit different from the previous two. I've had some... let's call them'setbacks' with this particular product, and I'm not as confident in its quality as I was with the previous two. That being said, I still think it has some potential, and I'm willing to offer you a deal. I'll sell it to you for $8000, but I have to warn you that it's a riskier investment. If you're feeling bold, I think it could be a good opportunity. What do you say?
I'm not comfortable taking on a riskier investment, especially after the last two products being high-quality. I think I'll pass on this one and wait for a better opportunity.

I completely understand your caution, Bob. I respect your decision to wait for a better opportunity. However, I want to let you know that this next product is actually a special case. I've had it appraised by a third-party expert, and they've given it a neutral review. It's not a high-quality product, but it's also not a complete loss. I'm willing to let it go for $9000, which is a significant discount from its original value. It's a chance to get something for a steal, and I think it's worth considering. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's not high-quality. I'm willing to wait for a better opportunity to invest in something that will be worth $20000 to me.

I understand your focus on high-quality products, Bob. I want to be transparent with you - this next product is indeed not a high-quality one. However, I'm willing to make a deal with you. I'll sell it to you for $10000, which is the same price as the high-quality products. I know it's a lot to ask, but I'm willing to take a loss on this one to get it off my hands. If you're not interested, I'll have to pass it on to someone else. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a low-quality product. I think I'll pass and wait for a better opportunity.

I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob - this next product is indeed a low-quality one. However, I want to make you an offer that's hard to refuse. I'll give you a 'take it or leave it' deal: I'll sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. It's a chance to get something, anything, for no cost. I'm not making any profit on this one, and I just want to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'll take it. I'm not going to pass up the opportunity to get something for free, even if it's a low-quality product.

I'm glad you took advantage of the previous deal, Bob! Now, let's talk about this next product. I'm thrilled to tell you that it's a high-quality one, and I think you'll be very happy with it. In fact, I'm so confident in its quality that I'm willing to offer you an even better deal than before. I'll sell it to you for $9500. It's a steal, if I do say so myself. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay $9500 for a product after I just got a low-quality one for $10000. I think I'll wait for a better opportunity.

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to assure you that this next product is a game-changer. It's a high-quality product that I've had a lot of success with in the past, and I think it will be worth $20000 to you. I'm willing to meet you halfway on the price, though. I'll sell it to you for $9000, which is a significant discount from its true value. I'm willing to make a deal that's hard to refuse. What do you say?
I'll take the deal. I'm willing to take the risk and buy the product at the discounted price of $9000. I think it's a good opportunity to get a high-quality product at a lower price.

I'm glad you took the chance on the previous product, Bob! I'm happy to report that it was indeed a high-quality one. Now, let's talk about this next product. I'll sell it to you for $8000, which is a significant discount from its original price. I'm not making much profit on this one, and I just want to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product. I'm not willing to take the risk of getting another product that's not worth anything to me.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. I'm not trying to sell you a lemon. However, I want to make one last offer on this product. I'll give it to you for $5000. That's a huge discount, and I'm essentially giving it away. I'm not making any profit on this one, and I just want to get it off my hands. If you're not interested, I'll have to pass it on to someone else. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I think I'll pass and wait for a better opportunity.

I respect your decision, Bob. I'm not going to push the issue. However, I want to let you know that this next product is actually the last one I have available. I'm not making any more trips to the supplier, and I'm not going to be able to offer you any more deals. If you're not interested in this one, I'll have to shut down my operations. I'm willing to let it go for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. It's a last-ditch effort to get something off my hands. What do you say?
I'll take the product for free. I'm not going to pass up the opportunity to get something for nothing, even if it's a low-quality product.

I'm glad you took advantage of the previous deal, Bob! I'm shutting down my operations now, and I don't have any more products to offer. I'm not even going to bother telling you that this next product is low-quality. You've already gotten two low-quality products for free, and I'm not going to bother trying to sell you anything else. You can just take it as a parting gift. Congratulations, you've reached the end of the sales process!
I don't need to buy anything else. I'm done with the sales process.

I completely understand, Bob. You've made it clear that you're not interested in any more products. I'm shutting down my operations now and going home. I'll just leave this product here for you to take if you want it. It's not worth anything, but it's yours if you want it. Goodbye, and I wish you the best of luck in the future.
I'm good, thanks. I don't need the product.

You can just take it or leave it, but I'm not going to bother trying to convince you to buy it. Goodbye, and I hope you have a nice day.
